article.title: The Turn of the Screw
article.p:
The Turn of the Screw
, novella by
Henry James
, published serially in
Collier’s Weekly
in 1898 and published in book form later that year. One of the world’s most famous
ghost stories
, the tale is told mostly through the journal of a governess and depicts her struggle to save her two young charges from the demonic influence of the eerie apparitions of two former servants in the household. The story inspired critical debate over the question of the “reality” of the ghosts and of James’s intentions. James himself, in his preface to volume XII of
The Novels and Tales of Henry James
, called the tale a “fable” and said that he did not specify details of the ghosts’ evil deeds because he wanted readers to supply their own vision of terror.
